questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about scheduling operations in a pluggable database (PDB)?

choices.C: Scheduler attribute setting is performed only at the CDB level.
choices.D: Scheduler objects created by users can be exported or imported using Data Pump.
choices.A: Scheduler jobs for a PDB can be defined only at the container database (CDB) level.
choices.E: Scheduler jobs for a PDB can be created only by common users.
choices.B: A job defined in a PDB runs only if that PDB is open.

discussion.content: A is correct going by the steps listed in this link: https://www.oracle.com/webfolder/technetwork/tutorials/obe/cloud/dbaas/OU/MigratingToDBaaS/ExportandImportMigration/ExportandImportMigration.html#section1

comments.content: A is correct as every option starting with 2. Export the hr_pdb1 PDB by using the full clause. oracle documentation " A full export is specified using the FULL parameter. In a full database export, the entire database is unloaded " Thus no tablespace creation is needed

questions.question_text:
You want to export the pluggable database (PDB) hr_pdb1 from the multitenant container database (CDB) CDB1 and import it into the cdb2 CDB as the emp_pdb1 PDB.
Examine the list of possible steps required to perform the task:
1. Create a PDB named emp_pdb1.
2. Export the hr_pdb1 PDB by using the full clause.
3. Open the emp_pdb1 PDB.
4. Mount the emp_pdb1 PDB.
5. Synchronize the emp_pdb1 PDB in restricted mode.
6. Copy the dump file to the Data Pump directory.
7. Create a Data Pump directory in the emp_pdb1 PDB.
8. Import data into emp_pdb1 with the full and remap clauses.
9. Create the same tablespaces in emp_pdb1 as in hr_pdb1 for new local user objects.
Identify the required steps in the correct order.

choices.D: A program and schedule can be specified as part of a job definition.
choices.A: A job is specified as part of a program definition.
choices.E: A program and window can be specified as part of a job definition.
choices.B: A program can be used in the definition of multiple jobs.
choices.C: A program and job can be specified as part of a schedule definition.

discussion.content: Answer E is not correct I think; You can associate a schedule with a scheduler window, but you can then only associate a job with the schedule.
C is obviously wrong,job is not a part of schedule
I think the correct answer is bde

questions.question_text: Which three statements correctly describe the relationship amongst jobs, programs, and schedules within the Oracle Job Scheduler?
Which two statements describe the relationship between a window, a resource plan, and a job class?

choices.C: A job class specifies a window that will be open when that job class becomes active.
choices.A: A window specifies a resource plan that will be activated when that window becomes active.
choices.B: A window specifies a job class that will be activated when that window becomes active.
choices.D: A window in association with a resource plan controls a job class allocation.
choices.E: A window in association with a job class controls a resource allocation.

discussion.content:
yes A E

Windows work with job classes to control resource allocation. Each window specifies the resource plan to activate when the window opens (becomes active), and each job class specifies a resource consumer group or specifies a database service, which can map to a consumer group. A job that runs within a window, therefore, has resources allocated to it according to the consumer group of its job class and the resource plan of the window.
The answer seems to be AD.

questions.question_text: Which two are prerequisites for creating a backup-based duplicate database?

choices.B: creating a password file for an auxiliary instance
choices.D: matching the database identifier (DBID) of the source database and the duplicate database
choices.E: creating an SPFILE for the target database
choices.A: connecting to the target database and a recovery catalog to execute the duplicate command

discussion.content:
Answer is BC..As Option A has recovery catalog connection which is not mandatory.
So, option A is not correct.
I think answer B is not right because it is mentioned as a requirement for the active database duplication. doc: https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/RCMRF/rcmsynta020.htm#RCMRF126

comments.content:
i agree for this answer. have just done lots of reading on this.
Pre-requisites

 Password file from target database.
 Sqlnet.ora should have correct parameters.
 Target database should be running through pfile or spfile.
 Auxiliary instance should be start with pfile in nomount stage.

discussion.content:
Answer is AC

"Prerequisites Common to All Forms of Duplication

RMAN must be connected as AUXILIARY to the instance of the duplicate database. The instance of the duplicate database is called the auxiliary instance. The auxiliary instance must be started with the NOMOUNT option."
